OHRNnv2IQltbvgmrs5N3Wg.text: This restaurant was one of the few in the Chinatown Plaza to have good Yelp reviews so we decided to give it a try.  The beef roll was awesome.  It wasn't oily, burnt, and hard like the other ones I've tried in the San Gabriel Valley.  I had the spicy minced meat dry noodles and they were good and filling for under $10.  Service was quick, which was nice since Las Vegas was a stopping point for us before heading to Zion National Park.

xgSWOWY5tQ6Aij4ASdaSTw.text: my friends ordered their soup noodles and are good as other reviews wrote,  but the rice dish i ordered is soso. suggest to orDer noodle soups.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Pot - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FvtektsU3WxP4BGdXQXxyg.text: A great hole in the wall restaurant in Chinatown. Don't expect a modern and fancy establishment just a small family owned and operated placed that is delicious. Taiwanese style soup great for cold days and nights. Personal favorite is their Wonton Noodle Soup and Beef Roll. Another option if your in the mood to have Asian style soup oppose to Vietnamese Pho. However this place can get very busy with tourist and locals because of its popularity but the turnover is pretty quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Pot - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Wonton Noodle Soup &amp; Beef Roll.

zGmsw1pEGDZipbUgzv9wXQ.text: More like 3.5 stars. Taiwanese beef noodle soup is what I ordered because I'm looking for something similar to Din Tai Fung's. This place is located next to Chinatown Mall behind a statue and where there's a "2-Hour Parking" limit painted on each parking spot.  The people here barely speak English and the few diners the day we went were Chinese and Taiwanese slurping thei soup away - signs of authenticity? Perhaps. Our food came out quick and piping hot. My beef noodle soup wasn't very meaty and I got some with lots of fat. There's fresh bok choi...yum. Noodles were cooked perfectly.  The food was good but sadly, it wasn't even close to satisfying my DTF beef noodle soup craving. I'm still on the hunt for DTF-esque noodles.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Pot - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef noodle soup

5DkEMD-UenounbjXSCcJFQ.text: Location: Noodle Pot is located in a 99 Ranch Market shopping center on Spring Mountain Rd.    Parking: There is ample parking available for its patrons.   Description: Chinese dumplings, beef noodle soup, small cold dishes, beef rolls, rice dishes  Service: it's average for busy Chinese restaurants, don't expect anyone to be patient while taking your order, fast speed, Mandarin speaking   Quality: above average dumplings, above average tea eggs, above average beef noodle soup, below average won tons  Environment: medium noise, cramped seating, tables are a little oily; The restaurant seats a limited amount of people so this place is not ideal for large parties.  Value: mid-priced, not cheap but also not expensive   Diagnosis: return visit approved

w8sUmHiLhnktxlkrrRobqg.text: Our first time here, my sister told us about this place.  We had the spicy beef noodle & chives and pork dumplings.  Everything was so yummy, the beef was so tender.  We'll be back for sure.

w8uJMfd3ggLBwDr1Ppv-eg.text: The beef noodle soup is delish. Fast service but there is always this one lady thats rude, never smiles and always walks away while ur still ordering. Other than that the food is amazing! Perfect for quick lunch

OoBA3SpdXC3GIYu5xvLVNg.text: Had beef noodle soup and meatball soup and scallion pancake. All very authentic and delicious. Server is pleasant and fast. Definitely recommend this restaurant.

mXtfKorVNmfPwrt_h8vfHA.text: Food-wise, it's about a 3.5.  The beef noodle soup was pretty good.  The service was terrible.  Yes, I've been to tons of Chinese restaurants and in general, they're not known for their service.  But I've never been to a place where they refuse to make you something on the menu because they "don't have time to make it".  And I'm not talking about a Peking Duck that takes half a day to make; I'm talking about a fried egg, on the menu as a side.  Umm... ok what about the soy sauce egg?  It's on the menu too.  Nope, sold out of them.  20min later I go back into the restaurant to use the restroom and right there sitting in front of two other customers, are 2 big and tasty soy sauce eggs.  Wtf?!  Anyway, plenty of places to eat in  eggs Chinatown.  You're not missing anything if you don't eat here.  Oh, we also got beef rolls, and they were very average.

bLhfDCrM2SJrnL76C_G2kg.text: Visiting Vegas my husband wanted to try a restaurant in Chinatown.  Drove to where there was a conglomeration of restaurants and parked.  Yelp rated this one pretty good so we said "why not".  Husband ordered braised pork over noodle which he said was pretty good. I ordered the eggplant and pork over noodle which was excellent.  Good choice!

DRpdtApj6ETryNKwxExEZw.text: I love taiwanese food so much. Food is legit in this place. Fast service for my hungry stomach.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Pot - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rice with fried chicken woohoo!!
Photo of Noodle Pot - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry noodle with minced pork was so goodd!!

y_QJoAmDr65ei4olefgOcQ.text: Excellent choice for Taiwanese style comfort food. Perfect flavors of beef noodle soup, onion pancake and dumplings. Great Asian tapas dishes like stewed meats, bean curd, seaweed and cucumber. Great food at a low price.  Not too far from the strip. Quick yet impeccable service. Will come again on our next Vegas trip.

pjblx-o9f2rw97Y4WyHsdA.text: I think its time I finally shared my spot for Taiwanese Beef Noodle soup. Its a small location, family-owned and already having a religious following of yelpers who eat there, this place gets packed easily.   Forget the other noodles soups on the menu, go straight to the best-seller, Taiwanese Beef Noodle soup. You wont regret it. So lets talk broth first, hearty, full of flavor with a medium body. Spice it up with their house-made chilli sauce. Superb. The noodles are cooked perfectly for me, a little soft and not too chewy. Served with huge helpings of vegetables and soft beef chunks. I approve sides orders of beef roll and wonton dumplings in chilli oil. If you're carb-loading the beef rolls are calling your name! Made like a burrito and cut into pieces. Filled with beef shanks marinated in hoisin sauce stuffed with fresh vegetables. Don't think I need to go into great detail of their wonton dumplings. Other than its swimming in a pool of chilli oil heaven. A must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Pot - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-zvWSeLYlJ3fNNtNwCV6rQ.text: Really enjoyed their beef noodle and beef roll. The beef roll is very unique that they wrapped the beef and cucumber with Taiwanese breakfast egg pancake. I never have something like that before. The reason I'm giving a three stars is because of the pork chop rice. It was very disappointing!  The pork chop was small and very very dry. They used broken rice which didn't go well with the dish. The whole combination of rice, pork chop and side dishes did not taste good together. I would like to come back and try more of their noodle or dumpling dishes and stay away of the rice dishes.

qD7lk_uxsAwsOW-qxx2XFw.text: Pretty good, not great. Got spicy beef and tendon noodle soup. Was good. But beef could be more tender. Not too spicy. I'd come back again.

Tayy9Zrb96P5Jty1Onha2w.text: The price is quite reasonable and the flavor is so great. It's like what I ate in China.

AHrDpfkhKl_597UW-BovIg.text: stumbled onto this place on yelp as i was looking for dinner near my hotel.  first off - im vegan  i got a marinated pressed tofu appetizer, which was just okay, and then  i ordered the vegetarian delight noodle soup. i don't think it had anything that wouldn't be vegan friendly. it had bok choy, a bunch of mushrooms, and some little sweet tofu looking things. it was honestly pretty good. can't complain. wasn't super salty like soups usually are so i really enjoyed it. it is a big bargain for ur buck since it's $8 and the bowl  is huge! i couldn't finish it.   service was alright. i mean i walked in and got seated right away. one of the employees asked me something in another language and idk what the hell she said lol. they checked up on us once and made sure things were okay. that was it really.  idk i probably wouldn't come back haha

Photo of Noodle Pot - Las Vegas, NV, United States. vegetarian delight noodle soup with rice noodles

cPuJr_SIPcY7vmCiu6oasA.text: I'd say this place has the best beef noodles in town! (Closest to Taiwanese flavor) I can't say much about other items cuz I only order beef noodles (#2)  & dumplings when I'm here. Food is Consistent everytime, service is good as well. They have tourist rush here and there but never had attitude.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Pot - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #2 thumbs up!

TRV8c8-Q5QSczEOkzcnKSw.text: My favorite place for noodles when I visit from the Bay Area. They are nice and authentic. It can get quite busy during lunch so watch your time.

4EPLKGoXAm0LdNT4M--iZQ.text: You know a Chinese place is authentic when they barely speak English. Found in a little nook in Chinatown Plaza, next to the Chinatown Mall, Noodle Pot is one of Las Vegas' hidden local gems. What's the appeal? Good home-cookin'. Their noodle soups and stews taste like Grandma has been slaving away all day in the kitchen so you can enjoy a delicious meal.  Portions are good for the price, although I personally wish it was smaller in size and a dollar or two cheaper. The joint itself is very small and homey, with almost all the patrons speaking exclusively in Chinese. The menu is fairly simple and easy to understand and service is relatively quick and painless.  I like this place enough, but not enough to crave it. The great thing is that their noodles are nicely cooked and I appreciate that they aren't too firm or too soft.

RKOBz1d-jlNPueW3VPo_mQ.text: It was July 4 weekend and we've been fighting thru traffic on the road for 5 hours. When we got to our destination it was more than 100 degrees outside. Although it was freakin hot, I was really craving for some noodle soup. I found this place through yelp. I was disappointed. I ordered the beef noodle stew. Beef was tender and the noodle was pretty good, but there's no flavor in the soup. The broth was plain salty. There was no flavor. I needed to drink plenty of water just to dilute the amount of salt I have just taken into my body. I probably would come back to try a different dish though. Service was good and just like the majority of restaurants in Chinatown CASH only.

V2YlmLQ98BcfxeP7ya1Pww.text: What's not to like about this place? Simple menu with a few noodle soup items and dumplings, that's it. I always have the beef noodle soup with an order of shrimp & chives dumplings. Just make sure you bring cash with you since they don't accept plastics!!

Htdv5fXcSlcGyeru5shL7w.text: CHEAP AND DELICIOUS.  My friend Christi and I came in for a catchup sesh and immediately placed our orders for lunch - she had the Beef & Tendon Noodle Soup while I opted for the Zha Jiang Mien (dry noodles with sliced cucumbers, bean sprouts, and spicy pork that you mix together). They offered hot tea, which is nice for a fast food place (I always thought hot tea was mandatory at Chinese places, but I've discovered more and more places are trying to get away with charging for it..pfft). We also ordered the chive dumplings.  Food came out quickly, and it was flavorful, tasty, and not overdone with salt.   Only reason why I'm knocking off a star is the service. It seemed rather mixed - there was an older lady who was brusque while a younger server's kindness offset that attitude.   Will be back! Solid noodle shop, but bring cash!

KsECwtkNoF4knMrher-c1g.text: Definitely the WORST restaurant experience I've EVER had!!! I really doubt the credibility of the reviews here. I've never rated any restaurant lower than 4-star before.  It is only a little restaurant with edible food and horrible service.   We got the seats really fast because there was no waiting line. And then we were served 40 minutes later! We did ask for the waiter and he kind of ignored us for a very long time. I couldn't believe that they served the group behind us! Then we got our food 30 minutes later than that. THEN! We got the wrong food.   Seriously, just don't risk your mood or vacation in this place!

HKIQ4qW5nlLLFOFBQys_2A.text: So How did I find this place? Well my girlfriend and I wanted chinese food around 10pm, so i decided to drive to China town and Yelp what was nearby,. This is what came up.  I really wanted to like this place, I can get past that its basically a hole in the wall. A lot of these places are but the food wasnt that good here. We ordered the Beef noodle soup, it said that it would be spicy but it wasnt. It had a little flavor, but similar to pho it tasted strongly of cilantro. There wasn't a lot of beef, it was mostly fat and unchewable other pieces. The noodles we're good. If I just ordered this I'd prob give this place 3 stars.  We also ordered the Beef Stew Rice. For whatever reason It didn't register that we ordered Beef stew, We thought it would be beef fried rice. But it was what it said. Beef stew (which was just ok) served over white rice. It wasn't very good. I don't know if this is considered authentic Chinese or what, but it was just ok.   I have a feeling we should of ordered the dumplings. I will say the waitress was super nice and friendly.

tu23rjozRXn11-be0lQaWQ.text: Walked past this restaurant one evening with a bunch of Yelpers and was finally able to try it this weekend. After looking at there menu, I was surprised to find out the specialize in Taiwanese cuisine  What really caught my eye was the fact they have shaved ice, Taiwanese-style. The selection of additions is limited. They have all the usuals though: grass jelly, lemon jelly, red bean, green bean, taro, boba, pineapple, peach, and two or three others. Of course they have simple syrup and sweetened condensed milk. They advertise a special "black sugar" shaved ice, but that was not available both times I was there. There is only one size of shaved ice available and the price was under $6 for a large serving.  The other menu item that caught my eye was the beef noodle soup! You can get it with thin or wide noodles. On their menu, the option for "hand-pulled" noodles is listed, but after asking, the chef that does that was not there that day. Unfortunately, the dish itself was only average. The soup was not too salty, had good beef and star anise flavor, but it was also very, very oily. We ordered half meat, half tendon, it came to us more like quarter beef and three-quarter tendon. The meat was not braised long enough and was still a little tough. As for the tendon, they only had thinly sliced tendon, no big chunks, so it was very tender.   I also ordered their plum drink. It was not the style I liked, it was not brewed. Instead, they took the dried, salted plums and threw it into a pot of hot water along with some sugar, there were no other herbs or flavor to the drink.  Service was quick and friendly, they always kept my ice water full, so no complaints there. Overall, I would definitely come back for there shaved ice, especially on those hot summer days. I don't think I would go back for their beef noodle soup, but I would definitely like to try their other dishes: dumplings, pork chop rice, etc.

u4EPmTgPDD-xxFDoe7_STA.text: Where can I begin..... We wanted some authentic Chinese Noodle soup, so we went to China Town of course. Upon entering, we had high hopes, but as soon as the waitress opens her mouth, we know we came to the wrong place.  The older waitress was rude beyond belief, we  do speak Chinese, so communication wasn't an issue, but she kept on hurrying us when the restaurant wasn't that busy, and when my friend was choosing the small dishes in the fridge, she even said she's leaving if we can't make up our mind......... Now let's talk about the food.  I ordered the clear beef noodle soup, and when it arrived, it's Vietnamese Pho soup base with Chinese Beef Noodle soup ingredients, I have never tasted anything like it, and I hope I never will.  The soup base in all of our noodles are just too sweet from the msg, and the portions are not impressive either. I wonder how can they stay in business, maybe suckers like us out of town tourists was what kept them in business.  I will let all of our friends know to never visit the place again. And finally, they need to seriously hire or train their staffs to be nice to the customers, I don't care where they're from, basic service skill and attitude should be learned before working as waitresses.

udNB8J2-UZWc6-1BeQ_NLg.text: Just like the other reviews, a healthy alternative to pho!! Def good. Def cheap. The noodles are incredible!!

vRaMqZrMEh3cMQOPEv69Cg.text: Man oh man you have to love a spot like Noodle Pot.  Small, family run place in the 99 Ranch plaza serving awesome noodles and dumplings at reasonable prices with great service.  They refilled my water like 5 times when I was there (very dry tonight).    Went with a group and we shared the following:  1) Dry noodle dish ja jiang mein - their noodles are really great.  I'm not sure if the version we had was with the hand cut noodles but whatever it was it was great.  Noodles were nice and tender with just a little bit of a bite still to them.   2) One order of chive dumpings, one order of napa cabbage dumplings - yum.  Nice pork dumplings with your choice of veggies.  Meat was nice and flavorful.  Served with a soy sauce based sauce that was nice as well.   3) Soup dumplings  - delicious  Wish I could go into more detail but my knowledge of asian cooking techniques isn't really on par with my knowledge of Western cooking.  But everything was really delicious.  I will definitely be going back again and again.  My new favorite restaurant in Chinatown Las Vegas.

qiU-0kCW774mF7_Ym0Tl1Q.text: Zero star .......   They have really bad service... Wrong order, bad attitude, even worse, no apology for their mistake.....  And their food are horrible x 5....I will never ever come here again

Z-UeInqJNmU7yQGzCMmYXw.text: This reminds me of a spot I ate at in Beijing called "Hao Chi Bu Gui"  which means Good and Cheap!  Basically it's good home cooking that won't break the bank -   Dumplings, soup dumplings, noodle soups, cold dishes, etc.   I'll warn u - if you have an MSG intolerance then stay away.  But MSG and cheap Chinese food are like peas and carrots.  Live a little wrong and get multiple refills of H20.  The dumplings were very good - not dry on the inside and had a nice moistness.  The soup dumpling aren't like China Mama or the "Xiao Long Bao" as you all know.  It's basically 8 big dumplings in a bowl of soup which definitely had the most MSG kick to it.   Last, the service was great.  We were asked how our food was multiple times.   The waitresses even made conversation with us -  This was probably because the mother/daughter team wanted to tag-team my Taiwanese friend - HoCash.   Nevertheless the food and service were awesome which is why I'll be back and i encourage Yelpers to check this place out.  *EDIT*   the last 3-4 times i've been here the beef roll has really dissapointed.  they have been undercooking it and the roll is not crisp.  It's china town so ask with caution but u may wanna ask them to crisp it up b/c it s definitely better this way.    the boiled dumplings are always yummy

1X1r7o5uWGQAOmS38DQG_w.text: This place is wicked!  I love their soup.  The look of the place can definitely push you away if you expect something Panda Express.  The place is clean but, is a hole in the wall that just has good food!  I've ordered both the wonton and beef soup with thin noodles.  You have a choice of thin or wide noodles.  I also believe the noodles are home made!  I've also tried the breaded pork over rice.  Super good!  If you're down for some home made style soup I would say this is the best place in town.  I would give this place 5 stars if the interior was a little nicer and if they took credit cards.  Cash only =(

OnOFN1LgPCZ4_d6WTVK-Rg.text: The service is off in a funny/cute way here...i asked the girl to recommend some non-meat noodle offerings and she recommended the beef noodle soup...hahaha... I gave in and said ok just easy on the meat.  Great deal for $8.

6j-eNZ_UCELThaqX3jUj0g.text: Okay... I start by admitting that I'm no expert on Chinese food, but I have been around a bit. The food here is delicious and the service friendly and fast. Fancy it is not. But I don't mind that if the food is good. I had the won ton soup and dry minced pork with noodles. Both were full of complex flavors and seemed to be fresh and high quality. Total price with a nice tip was $15.

o2ouuWY-fn9mtFEiDrD9IA.text: Very friendly place. When I first went in, I did not know it was a Taiwanese place until I saw Taiwanese TV shows being broadcasted on the LCD screen. We had the beef noodle and wontons with spicy sauce. I thought the food was OK, and the prices was average. But being Taiwanese myself, I found warm feeling about this place. I'll definitely come back, maybe even bring some friends from work.

MFAjUbGX2vtJ17fOX_Bisw.text: Yum, all I can say is YUM. Finally a small mom and pop store that sells authentic chinese noodles that actually taste good!  We ordered: 1) Beef Stew Soup Noodle (lamian)- wide noodles. Its a hearty, rich soup. Noodles are perfectly cooked, light and chewy goodness! Remember good korean & chinese noodles should have a bite, not soggy or too soft!  2) Pork Chop Rice- the pork was not greasy at all, the ran out of rice so they gave up a bowl of vegetable broth with bok choy and regular noodles. The broth was very very light & had a slight hint of an onion taste!  3) Zha Jian (lamian)- wide noodles. Its the orginal version of a korean chachang myeun. Sooo refreshing with the cucumbers lbean sprouts! This was my fav!  4) Boiled Dumpling (chives)- mmmm tastes like my mom's homemade dumpling. Chives & shrimp chunks.   5) Meat cold dish combination- marinated tripe, pork, tendon. The sauce they used has a nice, slight spiciness to compliment the meats.  Overall, my bf, friends and I would definitely come back here. We can't believe this place opened up last november. Also, you know they use real ingredients & not msg when you walk out without being thirsty :)   I've always been a supporter of mom and pop stores & this store deserves an A+!!!

n_x2xpQi1RrYmg4F1ptUVA.text: That is the worse Chinese restaurant I ever go ! Food is ok , services really bad , there is no waiter out there , only one mid-age woman both do service and cashier !                   I went to eat dinner with my little one , I asked for high chair , the lady want me to bring by myself , that is awkward! There is no restaurant would do like that ! And she never smile to us ! No service at all ! I would not recommend it !

HLMcJRvpopGdVAM2ToKI3Q.text: Decent beef noodle soup, with just the right amount of spiciness.  However, service was unorganized and orders got mixed up.  One of our orders never came out and we had to remind the waitress that we were expecting another dish.  Prices are good though if you're looking for an inexpensive restaurant off the strip.

i-MUbSBJDDSLkTHeC-3NxQ.text: Very hole in the wall place but don't let that scare you away. The place is pretty tiny but there was no wait for lunch on a Sunday. Ordered the beef noodle soup. I'm not a big fan of the tomato like broth so opted out of that by ordering no spice. Soup comes with tons of noodles, meat, bean sprouts, and onions. It was very delicious and big portions! Also ordered the wonton with chili oil. Pretty darn good! Definitely worth a visit!!

_94EKkPvdlQziQ3ccZ4swg.text: YUM!  Tasty beef noodle soup!  Delicious wonton in chili sauce!  Everything else here kinda sucks but really why explore a menu when you have found gold?

7JpFbcSmvw1WS4Qam7MQ5w.text: Great authentic Taiwanese style noodle soups. We had the spicy stewed beef noodle soup(neeu rou mien) and the pickled mustard green/shredded pork soup. Both were excellent, authentic flavor. The onion pancake was average. We will come back next time we are in Las Vegas and tired of the "all you can eat buffets".

PtrrlusFGbYTIFVulZLAsw.text: My husband loves Noodle Pot and it is his favorite place to get some Taiwanese beef noodle soup. I've never had it here until my husband took me here when we were still dating. And then my parents would often bring take out back from their Henderson location.   One thing for certain is that they give you a nice hearty portion when you order their beef noodle soup. The bowl is giant, even when you order the take out version. A lot of the times, I can't finish an order myself. They give you a lot of noodles, which are cooked perfect -- it has a nice chewy, firm texture to it. They also give you plenty of beef but not all the beef is tender -- some are a bit tough but the flavor is great either way. The soup base is really good, probably filled with MSG but that's probably better than it being bland. The only thing is that I wish it was a bit spicier .. it wasn't very spicy. I typically have to add more chili paste/oil to it when I eat it.   What's great is that this place is usually opened until midnight. If you got some late night cravings, you can always come here. And by late night, I mean Cinderella late. The server that we had was really nice and quick. We didn't have to wait too long for our food to come.  They used to be cash only but now they have a machine that takes card :) So no worries, come with your plastics.

tIW1ik2gz2ib_d-GQPE8Pw.text: Ordered:  -Spicy beef noodle    The soup was very flavorful with lots of big pieces of tender beef. My friend was visiting from out of town and was looking for an authentic Chinese/Taiwanese restaurant and this place did not disappoint.  Will definitely come back again!

HX4uoV9jAAj6s614cqcLMw.text: I love this place! Dishes I'm used to having. I don't think their noodles are handmade, but that's not a problem because I love the texture of it. They are usually very generous with the food they serve. Service is quick. Menu is easy to understand. Prices are very reasonable for being in Las Vegas. Always parking spaces available. Convenient location. Employees are relatively attentive and friendly. Some of the best Chinese noodle dishes I've ever had in America.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Pot - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pickled cucumbers
Photo of Noodle Pot - Las Vegas, NV, United States. beef noodle soup with tendon

TuaJkWwE6iYoXlhBsWFc8w.text: This place is well known for its beef stew soup and overall a decent Taiwanese restaurant. I've only been here with my mom because she speaks Mandarin so I let her handle the ordering. They do speak English too though so don't be shy (I should take my own advice haha). Anyways, been here a few times and felt like it's time I finally wrote a review. We always get the beef stew soup with tendon whenever we visit. The only downside is that the taste of the soup tends to vary every time we come here. Some days, it's on the sweeter side while other days it's more spicy and savory. It's not consistent which is why I knock off a star. During today's visit we also got the smoked chicken rice dish which was good. You get a whole chicken leg. The chicken tasted great and it was tender. We also got the cabbage and pork dumplings. The dumplings are made in-house and steamed. Comes with a sweet soy sauce for dipping. It was nice a juicy. Overall this is a great place to visit especially on a cold day like today!

bDrVfZZso1G3Wn-AMSojSg.text: I've been here before...but sadly have to give it a lower rating. I pointed to a picture and the item menu, had to them read it back to me...and somehow the minced porkbecame tofu with hard boiled egg....though I was charged for the other item (per the receipt).  Pretty sure what I paid for costs more.   It's on the other side of town and I ordered takeout so it is not a simple hop to fix.    I was the only other patron in there when they opened so there were not busy.  I suppose this means that someone who called in a takeout order also got the wrong one.  And it means I'll be untying the entire order and checking each one if I ever go back.   Very unfortunate and very disappointing.  Normally wouldn't gripe but I just spent the week saying how great this was to a friend who just came back into town and I was treating her.  So not a good outcome.

ynnIIbEmblvT6vGdT0RpRw.text: Small mom-and-pop-ish Taiwanese restaurant tucked in the middle of that Chinatown plaza with the elaborate archway.   I ordered the spicy beef noodle with tendons and the broth was full of flavor; it was an MSG fuckfest in my mouth. Tendons were thoroughly cooked and easily sinkable through my teeth. Because of that I told myself I would be a regular from now on since I wasn't thoroughly satisfied with Liang's Kitchen's light broth.   However the service was not prompt and it wasn't like I was expecting it in a no-frills, run-by-FOBs type of establishment.   Forward to payment time and our server was dissatisfied with the tip I gave her and she had the nerve to ask for more and said if I didn't have enough on my card, "you can also give me cash tip."  I was like WTF 'cause I've never heard that in my life and she should be lucky she got anything despite the dismal service.  The soup was delicious but I'm not returning! Girl BYE!

HG3hbX1QZB5WFd5JetUA7A.text: So good. Small, very authentic, no frills Chinese place. Every person was Asian so it must be good. Went on a weeknight late and it was still pretty busy. Although I was tempted by a dry noodle dish or some dumplings I couldn't pass on the beef noodle soup. Got a side of marinated cucumbers, tasty. Oily, spicy, just like in Taiwan.   The beef noodle was excellent. The broth is thick and meaty with a deep flavor. Beef is so soft and the noodles are perfect. They have the "qui qui" (no idea how to spell that from Chinese) but the perfect chewiness that is so important for a proper beef noodle soup.  Highly recommend.

HsC3mv-DpR_NkUfd03frIQ.text: Probably one of the best spicy beef noodle soup shops I've been to.  The broth is really good!  None of that soy sauce laden msg stuff.  Noodles are chewy.  Delicious!  Hits the spot.    The space is small but they were able to put tables together for our giant group of 16.  Service is really fast.  Cash only.

KmoqRv-UgLPkDE6zBN_a6A.text: Visiting Vegas from the east coast and found this place. Absolutely delicious. I ordered the beef & tendon noodle soup, and I finished it in minutes. Would highly recommend this place. It opens until midnight but they start closing until 30 mins prior I believe.

k0Set5PtdHc2re35XLF8AQ.text: This place is "OK".  The noodle is nothing special.  The soup base is so so.  When it said half tendon and half beef, it means different than what you expect.  It is also a little pricey.  There are a lot of better places for noodle.

QendxpypzBBY6zPM-hjyag.text: Slurpy Slurpy.  I must say I passed by this place weekly or monthly and never ventured in until today with the wife. Must say, it was a great experience!  We were reading some of the Yelpers reviews and gave it a shot! We wanted some beef noodles.  1.  The noodles - What the heck?  They did not buy this stuff from the store did they?  I found that the noodles here were white noodles , but slightly larger than the norm. The texture was awesome and the taste was literally a leap year from the regular noodles I have tried.  2.  Tenderloin Beef Noodle Soup - So delicate, tasty beef. Just the write cut of beef with a bit of tender fat and melt in your mouth beef.  The soup was very nice, subtle hints of the green onion and parsley gave it a very distinct flavor. This is what the wife ordered, but I kept on stealing a bit to give it a taste.  3.  Beef Stew Noodle Soup.  I love chinese style beef stew and this meat was the perfect balance of spice, taste, texture and delicacy. Would the word buttery be best to use?  This soup is slightly spicy, with a darker more salty flavor.  This is the first time I have drank the entire bowl of soup after the noodles and meat were finished off.  That is how good this soup was.  They have other items I haven't tried. The menu is a slip of paper with the items on it and you mark it off just similar to a sushi order sheet.  You kinda have to know what the noodles are and the other dishes are, or look at the pictures in the window.  I am coming back with the kids to try many more things, the dumplings, the fried noodles and etc.  GK says, check this place OUT!!!

opzRVQzdbFxZdeWc0Vg8IQ.text: So this place would be comparable to those Taiwanese hole in the wall restaurants you would find if you are familiar with 626 in SoCal.  I stopped by for lunch and ordered the Zha Jiang Noodles.  This dish was very spicy, more than I expected.  The menu did have a chili pepper by the item, but I've never had Zha Jiang noodles that gave me the sweats.  Whoa buddy.  Besides that dish, I probably had the best beef rolls ever.  It was authentic style and they even added egg in it so it tasted like the Taiwanese breakfast Dan Bing.  Da Bomb yo!  Noodle pot taking it to the next Level baby! The only downside was it was really oily.  So you women prepare to start dabbing with your tissue.  I look forward to going back and trying the beef noodle that everyone is raving about.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Pot - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Minced beef on rice

8w5GuoyFUw7k4PzgcmvtlQ.text: Good Chinese comfort food spot!  Since the end of Ay-Chung Cafe....this place has the best beef noodle soup that I can find AND they have hand made noodles you can request for an extra $1.  Next to the beef noodle soup...you MUST TRY the Taiwanese beef roll/wrap....nice crispy flour pancake with hoisin flavored beef, cilantro, and some other goodies....I didn't get a chance to dissect this dish since I gobbled it up as soon as it hit the table.    Minus one star since they sometimes run out of certain menu items. The minced pork over rice is also a little skimpy on the meat side, but I'm a hardcore carnivore....also a little heads up....this is another CASH ONLY establishment

4kVG32AercDoza5kD_FPWA.text: My mom ordered the duck noodle, they gave her only bones, my beef brisket was sliced so thin. Prices are way too high, service is bad. This will be my first and last time there  $9.50 for a bowl of beef noodle? What a joke

emhnc0YShw_lVwCSsxF1tg.text: Super mom and pop shop, located in the huge Asian complex.  I ordered the beef and tendon noodle soup and it came out soooo quickly, I want to say it was under 5 minutes!   Service was pretty good considering there were basically only two girls serving all the tables and there was one table of guys that were just being absolutely rude and demanding.  Definitely tipped them a bit more just for having to put up with those idiots.   If you're into beef noodle soup, great place to come, they do have little side dishes that you can order as well, I think I might have to come back and try the wontons in chili oil, i keep reading about all the rave! :)

fBgRd5AmqTqRlmOR_w-1oA.text: Priced right!  Delicious food!  Open late!  Noodle bowls and beef roll were great!

3m-MR5m5_w5W3RcjqEbGJQ.text: A mandatory gratuity fee of 15% is added to your bill for groups of 5 and more. For 15% tip, there was no service, food was just dumped onto our table, no greeting, took asking two different people for drinks, ladies here were incredibly rude.

FpY6YXmw1SN2MeV4G-HC4A.text: Went here on a whim and ordered the potstickers! MUST HAVE! My sister ordered the fried pork chop with rice and was also in heaven! Their staff is polite and the woman that took our order was so nice! We're definitely coming back her! For two meals and two drinks it came up to around $20! Not bad at all!

L86yxaXBEWxRiaFlrggMpw.text: Love is place...always come here when I am in town...beef roll is real good.  Also love the noodle and red oil dumplings.  Cash only.

nwlshv8m6luq3yyJlbDY2A.text: I'm on a trip from Singapore, and we have very good Chinese cuisine back home. When I came here I didn't have my hopes up, but oh my goodness, the  is phenomenal! Comparable to restaurant taste!

SMFTtuaMNkGplhgiHUhHqQ.text: Noodle Pot is in China Town and the definition of a hole in the wall. But don't be fooled. This little Tawainese cafe packs a punch. I venture to the storefront with the pig as its logo at the recommendation of my Tawainese banker.  She should know.  And she scribbled in Chinese letters on a piece of scrap paper at the bank the words for Liver Soup with noodles and I dutifully presented that to the cashier at Noodle Pot.  Ten minutes later I was immersed in a beautiful tasting broth with that wonderful fresh liver taste. Yum. Four stars for me. In coming back to try more.

JSmMC7LFFfdQINHRo9ZpPA.text: authentic taiwanese food :)  i was born and grew up in taiwan, so you can trust my review that this is probably one of the most authentic taiwanese restaurant in chinatown.  i ordered the beef noodle soup with no beef (i'm not a vegetarian, just wasn't craving meat) and they happily accommodated to my order. it was good and normally i would prefer my noodles to be a little thicker but i can definitely taste the taiwanese!   i also tried the pork chop and it was delicious as well, they cook it as stew so it's not your ordinary pork chop!   this place is small and probably sit a total of 30 people total but it has all of my favorite taiwanese dishes. keep in mind the owner and workers are all taiwanese and they will speak to you in mandarin when you walk in. also, it's CASH ONLY.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Pot - Las Vegas, NV, United States. beef noodle soup with no beef lol

NnQQf_UjgdijS4s3OWvgOg.text: Sumbling in to this place one late night, I have to say, I have become a fan. Pictures on the wall and friendly staff make ordering a breeze. Food might be a little strange if you are not open minded, but very yummy. The beef soup is spicy, but oh so good ... the beef roll is delicious - made with a tortilla, eggs, beef, and cilantro - the dry noodles may look like ... well, dog food, but tastes great!  To add to the authentic flavor of Noodle Pot, there is always a TV on a Chinese game show.  Open until 12 on weeknights, 2 on weekends, but these a hours vary based on ... well, if they feel like it - or someone has not messed up the broth.  Oh yeah, prices, simple and cheap.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Pot - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x9dVk8i3Cpk-NXvQVixxzg.text: So far, my favorite noodle soup place in all of LV.  You get a choice between their thin noodles and thick noodles.  Never had the thick ones, but they look OK.  The thin noodles aren't like egg noodles or anything - it's more like udon thickness if I have to describe it.   I've had the beef noodle soup a few times and its pretty consistent.  The broth, although dark, is not very salty (the times that I've had it anyway) and had a good flavor.  The beef is very tender and melts in your mouth.   I've also tried their wonton soup, which is good, but pales in comparison to the beef noodle soup.  I wish they had siracha there - it would make my soup complete (but that's just my personal taste).   If you're in the mood for rice, don't hesitate to try to the pork chop over rice.  A breaded pork chop and it comes with some minced pork over the rice.  Very good!  I like to take the extra beef from my soup and eat it with the rice.   The place itself is pretty modest.  Nice service and normally quick, although last time we were here they forgot to give me my side of rice until the end of my meal when it was already pointless.  But I like the food so that's what keeps me coming back!   My only gripe is that they take cash only (which is inconvenient for a person that doesn't carry cash!).  Instead of going to an ATM, just walk over to the Ranch 99, buy something small, and get some cash back.    Anyway, a solid noodle spot.  I can't wait to take my dad, who is a beef noodle soup fanatic, here one day

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Pot - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef noodle soup

2VEtQV-RYNCPo5Qd-9r7gw.text: Typical Taiwanese food!!! Enjoy the delicious beef noodle soup and rice noodle soup a lot!!

N9vxNkreKYTrI8Z880gR2w.text: YES YES YES YES! I hit the spot today. Went into the Chinatown Mall in Las Vegas today since it's a must visit place when your Chinese (well, this applies to any city). We were craving for some good Taiwanese food (something a little better than Tea Planet). This place hit the spot as we walked in.   It was very similar to Taiwan's family owned shops. You walk in and the menu is on the wall on top of the cashier. Order first, then choose the empty table that you want to sit at. As stated before, the place is a family owned restaurant. The lady behind the cashier seems to be a relative of the cooks in the kitchen.   Anyways, as we are waiting for the food... I observed the family owned business. They were super nice to all the customers. But one thing that strucked us was the Taiwanese spoken by the girl behind the counter. She had some funny mandarin mixed with broken Taiwanese. We were speaking to her in Taiwanese and correcting her as she goes. She wasn't mad at us or anything, but it made the wait time seem short.   Food on the other hand was excellent. I love the beef noodle soup! It was very close to what you can get in Taiwan. Broth was definitely tasty and the meat was juicy and tender. Noodles were thick and flat! Oh, and unlimited supply of preserved veges for the beef noodle soup! One more thing, try their dumplings and their cold dishes. Those hit the spot too. In fact, it was so good that I craved to go back for the next 5 days while I worked in Vegas.   They open til 2am on couple days of the week.  Go! you don't be disappointed!

2b8CYtSFaxqLGNrP46H5-A.text: Cheap food and hits the spot. The place was pretty basic and simple. We were just there for the noodles and noodles we got! We came out pretty late and there wasn't many people around which was great.

56FBMvJk7Q_GztyNDLPlmA.text: Impressive noodle house. I love it.  I went two times this trip so far. If you like chinese beef noodle, you should try.  Its different than viet PHO.    Try their dishes too. Very good.

Q4Hy8CAC8SYDwssBPhiB-w.text: To me this is a basic noodle place.  It was pretty good but nothing really stood out to me as being "the best" or a stand out dish. I found this place last winter it is a deep rich hardy thick broth and hand cut noodles large pieces of beef (other options as well)  I get the beef stew my boyfriend gets the beef tendon combo.  It has bite and says spicy but I could handle way more if needed.  We also listened to fellow yelpers and got the spicy wontons those were delish, thanks Yelp!   The decor is minimal get the food and get out kinda decor.  I am always the only white person there and sometimes the only one who only speaks english.  Buses will show up and can sometimes have a line.  Like I said get your food and get out!  The service is typical china town service and I love it!  They are not rude but they mean business!    This place is so good I can almost eat a whole bowl!  We can also get our for around $20 without the appetizer.

0jlHh0HMPZfnwWW8qpP9Lw.text: Min $20 for credit card use. Mediocre beef noodle soup. Only one size noodle available at 6pm. Waitress service is so-so. Just a regular noodle place.

aSkfvsIaY9kigziEDaGBJA.text: Found this cozy little noodle shop while walking around looking for a decent (tasty but not too pricey) in this Chinatown plaza. I am a sucker for a good beef noodle soup, especially with thick chewy noodles, so that's three stars straight up ;) The noodles are hand-pulled and as a result are super long (think Rapunzel's hair) - like the whole bowl consists of about four noodle strands - and cooked just a little overdone, as they're a tad on the soggy side. But the broth is delicious, if a bit salty, with a generous helping of green onion and tender greens.  Then, we found out you could order more portions of noodles to put into your bowl for just $1 more. So good and so filling! My sister and I ate three portions and nearly had to be rolled out of the place. What a steal.  We also ordered their pork chop noodle soup - their regular thin noodles are just okay, also kind of soft - as well as pork chop rice and pig ears. All were tasty, with good breading on the pork chops, but definitely on the salty side. I drank copious amounts of water but had to flag down the waiters even when there was just one other group in the place. But it was almost 3pm when I was there so the older grandpas and grandmas that cook here were sitting down for a meal, but they jumped up when they found out we girls could eat. ha.  I'm definitely coming back here when I want a change from the buffets next time I'm in Vegas. They also offer free wifi but you have to ask for the password... and open till midnight every day and 2am on weekends? NICE. Noodles for all!

fIkBX08vIPHAYjayQ8m4_g.text: My recommendation to the fellow Yelpers.Do not come here to dine. I would give out 0 Star if there was an option. 0 star for this restaurant.  Shame on this restaurant.  As a Chinese customer myself, I was recommended by my friends to dine here.   That was a year ago. Things did not turn out pleasant. Let's say they do not take any credit cards or debit cards. It was OK, I promised my bud,it was my treat.I paid in cash. The total check was $35.  I left $45 on the tray ,which was 2 x 20 and. 1 x 5. (Leave her a $10 tip)  That shameless waitress took the tray,and she came back ,claiming that by saying that asuzing me only left 1 x 20 and 1 x 5 on the tray.   So instead of I tip her 10 bucks,I was short of her 10 dollars from the total check. I know how much money that I left on the tray(I am a BANK OF AMERICA CASH REWARDS CREDIT CARD FAN and I only carried $45 in total in my wallet on that day), she was rude and mistaken by mixing my money with other tables' change. I was even going to call 911 on the spot bcz she even refused to check her camera footage which there's a camera above the cashier register.    That night was the last night my dear bud in Vegas,thanks to that low intelligence waitress, he did not leave Vegas with a pleasant experience. He could testify me that I paid in full and left a generous tip in cash that night.  My recommendation to the fellow Yelpers.Do not come here to dine. I would give out 0 Star if there was an option.

claJ9nvWKRjhjl_DR88pbA.text: This is my go-to noodle spot for Taiwanese beef noodle soup in Vegas. The broth has really flavorful and the meat / tendon is very tender. It's a  no frills restaurant, so don't expect great service or extensive menu. It is basically noodle soup, noodles and dumplings. Very basic but they are good at what they do.

LU0Vg26XU14ZjZ0ph5u51g.text: I've been coming to this place almost everytime im in town.  I'm in love with their beef noodle soup & beef rolls.  The menu is really small but the serving size is very generous.  Flavor is way better than anything lately that I've had in the SGV.  If you are visiting & home sick this place is a must try. They have interesting pictures on the wall of the customers but they always have their AC on full blast.  They also provide free wifi.

iV2vRcmQiWzL4t20NuedOg.text: This place was great!  So glad my friend chose it.  It is very small and you can only pay in cash!!  It's pretty good prices, so you don't need too much.  When we first walked in, it was super crowded. Every seat taken and a line out the door. However, the line moved pretty quick and by the time we got to the front, a table had cleared.   My friend had been many times so he suggested their famed Spicy Beef Noodle Stew. Another person ordered the one with tendons too, so I joined in this adventure and got the Spicy Beef and Tendon Stew.  Glad I did...it was delicious. Although my novice side showed, because when I eat these soups with noodles, I splatter juices all over me, the people at my table, and 3 tables over. :P Since I had somewhere to be afterwards and know of my rookie noodle eating skills, I was smart enough to wear a napkin bib. No, I didn't look like a tool at all. LOL!  Anyway, my friend also ordered the wontons in chili oil and they were delicious too! Definitely will be back with an old T-shirt or bib in hand! Yum!

TBH6Bem8-W2yWpcgh4KUIg.text: My husband went in to get me Wonton Noodle Soup, and the woman working the counter for take out orders was extremely rude to him. The soup was very bland, oily, and the thick noodles were over-cooked. First time trying this establishment and will not be returning.

jGocM9ePmzmM2L_SgQMnSw.text: We were visiting Las Vegas for a week and decided to visit Chinatown. This little restaurant is perfect for a light meal before dinner. It was excellent. We live in Seattle so most of the noodle dishes are Cantonese so the noodles and the broth at this Taiwanese restaurant were very different but delicious. I had the salty duck with noodles and the others were wonton noodles and soup. All good! The egg rolls also were yummy. Service excellent. Busy little place and good food to boot!

pDU6jeUNfnV-Hj3O9ug6sw.text: This is my #1 spot for beef noodle soup (niu rou mien) in Las Vegas. While it isn't Taiwan, this comes pretty dang close. The broth of the beef noodle soup has a very strong tomato flavor, just how I like it. Expect a kick from the broth as well. Noodles are spongy and plentiful. We were one of three parties in the restaurant and service was very hospitable and welcoming. Prices are a little high-my normal order of tendon beef noodle soup costs $10.99. Minimum charge for credit cards is $20.

UjhdlwKdh3nBzegFvQ3bcA.text: This is the first time being at a Chinese Noodle place.  It's a nice little hole in the wall.  Very reasonably priced for the bowls of noodles. I had the smoked chicken leg and noodle soup. It was very good! It hit the stop. Next time I'll order the beef & tendon, noodle soup. I will come here again!

gbv-39Oa0wcI6i7GQliW1g.text: I like this small hole in the wall Taiwanese restaurant.   Their specialty is their beef noodle soup. I always order it with vermicelli noodles ( the clear ones) cause it's my favorite. It makes the dish feel lighter and less carbo loaded. I thought the beef was tender and the broth was rich in flavor.  Generous meat proportions too.   Their spicy wontons were good. The chili oil is not actually that spicy though. Looks intense but it's pretty mild in nature. Doable if you can handle a little spice.    I thought their beef wraps were a little disappointing. There wasn't much flavor to it and the beef was a little chewy. I wish they put hoisin sauce in it to make it a little sweeter and saucier.   Overall I would come back again but I'll stick to my beef noodle soup.

9eM5tR0lLvSOQBSN8UHOZg.text: Let's just start with getting one thing straight.   This place IS NOT TAIWANESE!  This joint could not possibly be more mainland hole in the wall noodle joint.  ALL the workers there are mainland and you can hear it in their tongue curling accents when they take your order.  Nothing here is authentic: The pork chop on rice, the beef noodle, the beef rolled in a pancake. All of which is their own spin-off and what you are used to in New York or California.  I say NY and LA  because nothing is as good as eating in Asia.   The earliest immigrants of Chinese people went to SF, then LA, then NY.  The Chinese food in Vegas off strip is just disappointing and made by a side cook, not a head chef.  Thier pork chop on rice is decent  The beef noodle is ok.  Anything else you are taking a chance.  The prices are a little on the steep side so I don't come here often.  Beef noodle is better at Shang, and no one else makes an edible pork chop on rice.    Chinese food is awful in Vegas.  My wife and I book an air BnB and drive back to Los Angeles for a weekend of good eats whenever we can.   NYC Chinatown is excellent too,  lived there for 30 years.  Vegas food standards suck outside of the strip.

0uRBh_Dw5fi1TN7QVVtlnw.text: We came here for a late night snack and the noodle soup was amazing. Must get the beef brisket noodle soup!!

jZNGd5XgxJyjAiI2vSmtcQ.text: Very authentic and delicious. I had wonton noodle soup and my daughter had the smoked chicken leg with rice that was extremely delicious! You will not be disappointed.

LaFilqLKHdKmMRWccVcPVw.text: FOOD:  Beef Noodle Soup  - they are known for their soup, and omg. This is one of the best noodles I've ever had: long, soft, and chewy, yet al dente. The beef tendon was definitely fresh and quality. It was soft with a nice chewy texture that melts in your mouth. The beef was perfect, better than my grandma's soup (sorry grams!) The broth was amazing as a stand alone, soul warming, savory and well rounded flavors, but I always add to my Asian soups out of habit. I love spicy, so I added like a tbsp (or two) of chili paste and a lot of sriracha hehe oh! And vinegar! You can't have Chinese noodle soup and not add a dash of vinegar. The portions are Large. When it first comes you think you couldn't possibly finish it, but you will! It's too good not to. 5 stars.  Chinese Chives Dumplings - I thought these were good, not amazing, but the family that treated me absolutely adore these dumplings. My friend thinks it's the perfect skin thickness and filling amount. personally, I love thick skinned dumplings, but to each their own~ I love the softness of the skin, and as a chives lover the filling was perfect, fresh with a hint a salt. 4 stars.  AMBIENCE  The usual small Chinese restaurant feels: casual yet intimate (in a platonic way) and a bit loud. There are small wooden tables and chairs, which can be pushed together for larger groups, the usual small bits of out of place flashy red and gold signs/decor and lots of happy chatty ppl. It can get a bit loud, but the small size of the place prevents it from becoming over the top.  SERVICE  Okay, it's a small Chinese/Taiwanese restaurant in Chinatown....service isn't great, but the food comes out timely and the place is always packed (from what I saw and what the family I dined with tells me) with only 1 server, potentially 2? Our waiter was very courteous, but we did have to walk up to the kitchen, only a handful of feet away from any of the tables, to add to our order or ask for refills on drinks. The place is a bit understaffed considering the huge lines (one for to go and one for dine in) outside the restaurant, and I came in 110 degree weather, so I wonder how much busier they are when the heat wave settles...  PARKING  FREE PARKING in the complex and right in front of the restaurant too! (Side note: it's within walking distance from 99 ranch to quench your Asian snack/drink/water needs). Also, I think Uber and Lyft are unfamiliar with the area, so make sure they drop you off at the right complex (pick ups and drop offs were confusing for them, but most did expect they'd be on the strip all night).  I'm basing my stars on food alone, 4.5 stars, and not on the ambience or service bc I don't think anyone rlly goes to these types of places expecting any different haha I know in the Asian community we mostly focus on taste, price, and value, and this hit it all! The food is inexpensive (I believe it was ~$60 for 5 ppl, not including tip, but Idk the exact amount since I didn't pay and couldn't see the bill bc, y'know, those stereotypical polite fights...) Anyway, I highly recommend this place! It will be my go to anytime I come back. And I look fwd to updating my review and trying their scallion pancakes and beef rolls? (Idk if that's the English name, but it's called  in Chinese), since those are the perfect snacks for drinking in Vegas.

MXqCvekoKhKe0vXHY57o9g.text: I've come here a few times because my husband's family is Taiwanese and they like these places when they come into town. If you come on a weekend or at night... WOW WOW WOW. This place is busy. Don't expect an atmosphere where people won't bump into you as you eat or that you'll be able to have a conversation. It is so cramped and you'll be elbow to elbow with strangers (literally, they put 2 of us at a 4 top with another couple because they had run out of room the last time we were here a few weeks ago. Grossed me out because the guy was hacking snot into his napkin and looking at it while we ate.)   This place really needs a bigger location. As is, it's too cramped for comfort. The do take cards now, but you will wait a long time for a seat and the soups are nothing to write home about. I did like that I could substitute out the noodles with a different type as I don't like traditional beef noodle soup noodles.

gStJxEwLvAlpHrdfc63jXQ.text: I use to frequent this location almost once a week which made me a regular. I go to West Charleston campus so this was my go to.   My gripe isn't the food but the service and management. So I ordered Beef Noodle Soup, which only a few minutes soon after, I grabbed the waitress's attention and requested my order to be substituted with wide noodles. Keep in mind, the food did not hit my table yet. The waitress said that it's already made (as in the kitchen) so my request had to be declined.   I'm never the one to feel entitled, I'm super understanding, and try to find a middle ground. Rather, she chose to shove this deal breaker to me. As this bowl of soup and noodles is skated onto my table, I'm just looking at my order as if it was forced upon me. I wasn't pleased as a customer, it wasn't the exact order which I had asked for, but yet, I'm expected to not only pay, but also eat it in misery. Out of all places, I chose Noodle Pot. And yet, this is how they chose to treat a regular. If they were smart about their business, with just a small accommodation, they could of made money on the ROI. As I continuously kept returning, especially with friends and family.  Long story short, I told the waitress/cashier lady that I don't think it's right to charge me for something I didn't eat. I initially was going to pay for my order but I pulled my card out because it didn't sit right with me. I said I didn't eat it because it is not what I requested as an order. She blamed me for not requesting wide noodles from the get go. She said she would modify my order and ring me up a new order as long as I paid for the first order. So essentially, she wanted me to pay for two orders. These bowls are $13 each. And I know they're also expecting a tip. She said she was the supervisor and I asked to speak to someone above her.   I was handed the phone with the manager to come to a resolution. As I'm explaining to the manager over the phone, he tells me that the waitress said that I've already ate the food. The phone was passed back and forth as they're speaking in Chinese and I'm explaining over the phone to the manager in English. Furious and frustrated, I told him that I'm not paying, and with that said, that I won't return back. The manager said and I quote, "yeah don't comeback, we don't want people like you, but you still have to pay". I wasn't going to leave cheated and hungry. And I didn't really want to simply walk out because it is not right. But I did coz i don't hand over my money to bad servicing cheaters.

R9jJk-mLEph1KtHrjybbdQ.text: Woot woot!! So glad we found this place through yelp!   I didn't think there was a decent Chinese/Taiwanese place to eat in Vegas.  This place is located in Chinatown, I believe in the same plaza as the 99 Ranch Market. Restaurant is a little hard to find, it's tucked in a little corner. The place is pretty small too and of course, don't expect anything fancy. CASH ONLY!  The beef noodle soup was phenomenal.. I loved the noodles and the broth and the meat was pretty tender too, I drank the entire soup! Boyfriend said it was a bit too salty, but i still enjoyed it. The dry zha jiang mein was okay, but a bit too spicy for me. We also had the wonton with sauce and that was pretty good too.  Overall, I'd come back here for sure.. I'm over eating pho every time we go to Vegas. =)

Yga27Zn1VYm1cQq_V51bPg.text: I've lived in and traveled around China long enough to have developed a deep craving for beef noodle soup, and this place hits the spot. Amazingly delicious food can be found in the skeeziest looking shops over there. Most places, families live in the same run down shack as their "restaurant"; so you'll often find the owners' socks and undies drying in the bathroom. You'll be faced with a few basic tables with creaky little stools, a menu board on the wall, and not much else. It takes some getting used to, but I've now come to associate the dumpiest looking shacks with the promise of the most soulfoul food. Noodle Pot is not terribly dumpy, but it does have that basic noodle hut vibe. It's tiny and simple. The menu offerings are narrow. And the soup is hearty and plentiful. Eight bucks will get you a very substantial bowl of tender beef and noodles with the ubiquitous bok choy. Make sure to doctor it up with plenty of whatever is in the jars and bottles on the table (most likely dark vinegar, soy sauce, and chili paste). Then say so long, tuck in and disappear. The flavors are deep and satisfying, right on the money. One senses that many hours have gone into the rich broth and meltingly tender beef. The noodles don't appear to be hand made, as they lack the characteristic tenderness and touthsomeness. These are fine, but they don't make the dish which is all about the beef and the broth. Rather disappointing was the cold cucumber dish I ordered. In China the crushed cucumber dish is about as standard a way to begin a meal as the bread basket is in the west. Over there you will get fresh chunks of crunchy cukes dressed lightly with rice vinegar, and often accompanied by peanuts. Cold, crunchy, salty, a bit of sour--it's a freakishly addictive way to begin a meal. The one I received at Noodle Pot was a sad, pale version of the standard. The cucumbers were soft and wilted, with almost no crunch or flavor. They had clearly sat too long and should not have been served.   Service is a non-issue in a joint like this. The gals take your order, bring your food and largely ignore you unless you flag them down. This is the norm in China, where you have to shout at the servers to get their attention. It isn't considered rude for them to ignore you, or for you to holler across the room at them. It's all business here; you come in, sit down, order your dishes, and start slurping. The evening I came in plenty of folks were crowded around the tables, hunched over, slurping away. It's exactly how it should be in place like this, and its why I'll be back.

3xMOk19lD-QKqNtlYyzmvg.text: I LOVE beef stew noodle. When my friend told me this place made really good beef noodle stew, I just had to try it.  However; this place was aver.  I feel like a lot of places I review are just average.  Haha.  I got the Beef Stew Noodles for 7.99.  There's a spicy version and a not spicy version.  People who can handle spicy will want something stronger as the spicy one was just ok. They do have some spices that can be added to your soup.  My friend added the chili sauce to her soup base.  The soup is perfect for a cold winter's day.  I  Their customer service is just meh.  It's typical Asian service.  When we first ordered drinks, we asked for ice water.  Another lady came out and brought us hot tea.  :(  When the lady brought out our noodles, I would have liked if she told us what each one was.  Luckily two of of us ordered the same thing, so we could tell.    My friend did rave about this place, so maybe I expected too much.  I might go back and try the beef noodle dumplings she recommended.  I think it's dumplings in beef noodle stew.

TTCvdSCL4szHuBXZeVY28Q.text: Small but authentic Taiwanese beef noodle soups place with small appetizer dishes. Reasonable price. Recommend.

Nk-zow-2W5T3DB3o_aY2HA.text: I give it 5-Stars because it is authentic.  Lots of choices on a tasty menu.  Expect to be cramped when dining in, fans blowing, foreign TV with no subtitles on, and lots of weirdness to a westerner.  If you think this place is weird or different, in an offensive way, respect the authenticity and broaden your horizon.  The food is great!

POIUPKVqihOJSQCVQACh8w.text: Came here during winter break, and boy was it packed. All the Asians came here for their Chinese food fix instead of going to some buffet at a casino.  Coming from a place with a lot of good Chinese food, I'd have to say that this place wasn't the best. It was definitely not built for too many people and there were a billion people here trying to get a seat. The noodles here are really good. I got the pig feet soup, and I thought they cooked the meat quite well. My family got the beef noodle soup, which I was pretty standard asian fare. This place doesn't wow, but it is a pretty good place for its location.

TSr1jRFAjPL3ehqb_Eg-qg.text: This is a hole in the wall and food is just ok. I had the following:  Beef noodle half tendon soup: good just a bit spicy. Pork cabbage, shrimp chives dumpling: not bad just very small and small portioned Pork rice plate: a few pieces of extremely fatty pork with lots and lots of rice Wonton soup: the pork stinks  Service was pretty bad and tea was diluted and taste like hot water.

MxYg9-caxL7Wg1f3UB6A0w.text: Fantastic Taiwanese Beef Noodle Soup!!  Have had it spicy or not spicy, this is by far the best I've ever had.  One member of my party was from Taiwan and said that the quality of the food/soup rivaled that of Taipei.  To say the least, this place is "legit."  Highly recommended, very cheap ($7.99 per bowl) and a very authentic feel.  Go here!

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Pot - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef noodle soup.  Amazing.

PZHRqQ1uXr2sx9rxr1lVmA.text: On several different occasions that I have been here, grown Chinese businessmen will walk in and order the beef noodle soup. When in China, do as the chinaman does.   Come here for their spicy wontons, and their beef noodle soup. They have a very delicate and carefully simmered broth that is packed with enough flavor to blow up everyone's mouth. I have been here about three times. Their wontons are different shapes every time, some times big and some times not.   Always wait for the uncle to be around to order your beef noodle soup because he tops the soup noodles with all of the extras just right and food tastes better with him around. His wife just doesn't do it as well as him, although the broth is the same, but inconsistency after excellency cannot be tolerated.   Am I coming back? Of course! I'll be waiting for the uncle.  Side note: if you order their fruit tea, order a glass of water to dilute it, because it is so sweet, it's almost syrupy.

ceyRJq6B2NKkRXxYqNRbtg.text: After multiple recommendations, I zipped over to the noodle pot for rainy day soup.  The service was friendlier than expected.  The place is little and hard to find if you don't know what you are looking for.   We shared the spicy won tons and I had the beef tenderloin soup.  The wontons were delicious, piping hot, and spicy. The beef tenderloin soup was excellent and flavorful.  The noodles were pleasantly chewy and the broth required no additions.   The beef was very tender and shredded right apart - reminiscent of a braised beef short rib - however, extremely fatty.  I spent loads of time removing large chunks of fat from my soup.   A delicious soup; something different than pho.  I'll go back.

s-NlcfHY7X9i0Gsbt9AHzw.text: This is one of my favorite places in vegas. I started coming here after world noodle shut down and im glad i found it. The beef stew noodle is great and im in love with the bok choy

The waiter misunderstood us and thought we ordered one soup and one dumplings. I started the noodles, which were good in itself but the entire noodle soup was unappetizing and not very tasty. The meat was fatty and looked like scrap.   I don't like food, and esp meat, to go to waste but I could not get myself to finish this.   The shrimp dumplings weren't that great either.   I won't be dining at this place again.

GXb02KLqq0cEBjqQlyMUzA.text: ...... Authentic? Or you could say it's a little run down, a little dirty and a little unwelcoming.   Noodle Pot is a little shop in the main Chinatown Plaza. Parking is free and never an issue and there is plenty of boba/dessert/bars to go to nearby.  The restaurant has less than 10 tables and no one seems to speak English. I'm glad my partner spoke Mandarin, because they seemed to become more welcoming once they knew we knew what we were doing. Whew.   The food is good and according to my Taiwanese friend, as authentic as you can get in Vegas. We ordered the noodles, beef roll and dumplings. The dumplings were good, but a little disappointing when I saw them pull out a giant bag of frozen dumplings from the freezer next to me. Do that where I can't see, guys.  Compared to Noodle Pot II, the food here is better. BUT Noodle Pot II is cleaner, newer, friendlier and more welcoming to those that aren't Chinese/Taiwanese food experts. Between the two locations, I would stick to Noodle Pot II.

O7riwG9vOkjHOCYoBb-QOQ.text: A lil gem spot in Chinatown Las Vegas... beginning to fill up with people so early in the morning

5xP4FBSl_CtmeYWzn3MVRA.text: Best beef noddles ever I have been looking for the same flavor all over New York and we haven't find any thing as tasty and good as beef stew noodle that is serve in this place.

lPrQQN-rYWffnBsB1-5OFA.text: Tired of Vegas buffets? Then venture out and don't be disappointed.  Noodle pot serves up some fairly legit Taiwanese cuisine that definitely rivals that in either LA or the Bay Area. The beef and tendon noodle soup is to die for. Packed with flavor, this soup definitely brings a little heat to the palate too...but all in good form. The beef was fork tender and the tendon was just chewy enough and not a hair bit tough. The noodles were excellent too. Chewy without being too dense. Definitely a winner.  We also tried the pork and chive dumplings. Very standard, but still well done. The skin was not too thick nor floury and dumplings had good filling. The pork chop noodle soup was an excellent non-spicy counterpart to the spicy beef and tendon soup. The pork chop was juicy and charred to perfection. The only dish that I thought could have been better was the ja jiang mien. It just didn't have much flavor in my opinion.

Z37ZMm2Lb8eAkm4rnOaVfA.text: If you want authentic Chinese beef noodle soup, this is the place to go. I ordered the regular beef noodle soup with wide noodles. I've been here a couple times and both regular and wide noodles are fresh and delicious. Definitely recommend this place for noodles!:)

B0so4gdRBaS-Bb_YlCNNMA.text: Soup noodles of any sort make for a perfect recovery lunch after a hard night in Vegas, and Noodle Pot does an excellent job with their beef noodle soup.  Prices here are cheap, and the service is friendly and fast.  I ordered the #2 with beef and tendon.  The broth is ultra savory and flavorful, and the quantity of meat is very generous.  There's just the right amount of spiciness too.  The beef is super tendor and absorbs all the flavor of the broth, and the tendon is soft and tasty as well.  There's also plenty of bits of vegetables that lend just a bit of texture and crunch to the overall dish.  This is about as good as any beef noodle soup can be.  The beef roll is just okay.  It's got an egg wrap and cucumber inside which is a bit different, but overall it's fine, just not really great or anything.  The cold wontons in chili sauce was just fine too.  Not a bad side at all, but nothing amazing either.  If you're craving beef noodle soup, this is definitely an terrific option.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Pot - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold wontons in chili sauce, and beef roll with an egg wrap and cucumbers.  Both good.
Photo of Noodle Pot - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef noodle soup with tendon.  This is what you need to get.

vn2K3J-QY3Uu1MAovBuFaA.text: Best I have ever had!!! Loved it I wish we had one back in Texas!! Everything I had was amazing and it's very filling!! Great place

0EYeen4R3a68IRyRJWn-qg.text: After talking to Michael K about my previous negative and less than impressed experience here, we decided to come back so I could give it another try. Remembering that the chicken rice dishes here are trash I went with a beef tendon noodle soup, Mike went with beef noodle soup, and we shared an order of wontons in chili oil. Judging by the items ordered, I can say that this place is authentic, as their noodle soups are served simiarly to what you would find in Taiwan.  The beef tendon noodle soup ($8.99) was tasty, with a generous amount of tendon which is the best part! The broth itself was flavorful even though I asked them to make it less spicy for me. They have a spicy and non-spicy version of this dish by the way, so you can also get it mild. The noodles and tendon were soft, very tender and perfectly cooked. I would come back just for this soup alone.  The wontons in chili oil ($6.50) was also an impressive dish, and it too was served the traditional way. The chili oil gave the wontons a nice oily flavor but wasn't too overpowering or spicy by any means. The wontons were thin with a decent amount of pork wrapped inside.  The service here was a lot better than the last time around and our order was correct with no issues whatsoever. It was interesting that we were the only ones here at noon and then all of a sudden the place exploded and a huge rush of several different parties came in at the same time. This place is pretty solid for their authentic noodle soups, but that's all I would recommend here as an entree.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Pot - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonton in chili oil
Photo of Noodle Pot - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef tendon noodle soup

vxJdx_iYBmpjBVCgZTgqwg.text: I tried this place last year and I failed to write a review. So far, this is my favorite place for Taiwanese beef noodle soup.   I ordered #6 beef & tendon noodle soup and #2 spicy beef noodle soup. Both of them were very tasty. The broth wasn't over powering but just right for my taste. I love the texture of their noodle. It's a cross between udon and ramen.   The servers speak Mandarin but they do speak some English. The servers are polite. If you want hot tea instead of water, ask for hot tea.   This place does get busy so come early for dinner. There's nothing like a nice beef noodle soup on a winter night.

DEqv-ceOEvsOKbAPpXko8Q.text: Brrrrrr...... It is super cold night here in Las Vegas (12/07/2013) we're talking mid 20's. Definitely soup weather.  Thanks to yelp, we found one in LV's Chinatown that's highly rated.   Service was very good. Specially accommodating a big group (w/ kids in tow) Food came out fast and the soups come out pipping hot.   Here's some of the rundown.  Beef and Tendon Stew Soup w/ Noodles (Spicy) - the soup was very flavorful, the noodles were perfect, the beef was super tender and delicious. The tendons on the other hand were very very tough. It's a shame, a 5 star soup became very disappointing.   Beef and Tendon Soup w/ noodles (not spicy) my wife's order was the same as my soup. Everything was good except the tendons. My sister in law had the same soup & she had tender tendons. (She got the first bowl) we got ours about 5 minutes after she got hers. I think the tendons were not yet ready. Like my wife said, 10 more minutes of cooking those tendons might have helped, I agree.   Crispy Chicken Leg Rice. Delicious. The chicken had a five spice rub concoction on it and it was fried perfectly. The rice had some mince pork & sauce on it. Yummy. It also came with half a hard boiled egg and a couple of vegi side dish, both very good as well. This dish was for my son, but me and my wife ended up eating the whole thing, sans the chicken skin which my boy scarfed down. I highly recommend this dish.   Everyone in our group enjoyed their meal. The kids specially liked the dumplings.   The hot soup certainly warmed us up at least enough to brave the cold LV night and back to our warm hotel.  I'll definitely be back

wfnmB07q-4bjY2jiABsTag.text: Let me preface that anyone who posted a negative review on this restaurant either doesn't know Taiwanese food or isn't Chinese.  My mother is from Taiwan and I visit yearly to see family.  I grew up eating authentic Taiwanese cuisine which is the best Chinese cuisine in the world.  Sorry Hong Kong.  The spicy beef noodle soup is outstanding almost as good as the version in Taiwan which is quite famous. This place reminds me of my mother's home cooking with very traditional dishes.  The beef noodle soup is hearty and rich in beef flavor with succulent beef chunks including tendon, baby bok choy, pickled mustard, cilantro and just perfect noodles.  My favorite appetizer is the beef wrap with thin green onion egg pancake encased around marinated beef slices, cilantro with hoisin sauce.  And you must order the wontons with spicy chili sauce!  Being in Chinatown, service is pretty good and even better if you speak Chinese or Taiwanese.

EIUv1sOpCzOkdWfrLSofNw.text: We just got back from vegas.  Just had to try Yelpers recommended beef noodles.  The noodles, beef and soup was so tasty.  It was so good that I cannot describe my feelings.  Definitely I will recommend it to all my friends.  Next trip to vegas will have this on my list.

K51Zn_yQlrIEbQQS_eOU8Q.text: This place was decent. I didn't get the highly touted beef noodle soup but got the minced pork rice dish instead. It was pretty tasty but not the best I've ever had. It did come with a good bit of vegetables. We also got pig's ear which was really tasty, very chewy. The wontons were reallllllly good! I would recommend them. The only complaint is that I asked for a tea refill, it was acknowledged, but not forthcoming. At that point I was pretty thirsty so was sad that I did not get more tea but it's not a deal breaker for this place. Aside from the lack of tea refill, service was really friendly and seemed like a nice family owned business. My sister and brother in law seem to enjoy their beef noodle soup (clear broth, not the spicy one because they're wusses and can't eat anything spicy). Other patrons seemed to be heartily diving into spicy beef noodle dishes so I'm sure it's delicious. I might come back if I'm ever out in the Vegas area again.

fev2imhS7-E-934o6wD79w.text: Really nice staff. Beef noodle soup was def a winner. Tried some beef tendons as well, and loved em. The red sauce on the table compliments the soup perfectly. I'm not a huge soup fan but this place was a winner

bX2Awg6fXxYuf6ZdXEjwMA.text: I love noodles, and I am always looking for good noodle shops around town. Noodle Pot is definitely one of them. My favorite dish is the Beef Noodle Soup, and adding seaweed to the soup makes it even more delicious!
